availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. French (Montgomery County, Kentucky, attorney and judge)

body.p: Montgomery County, Kentucky, attorney and judge. Kentucky native. Son of Richard French and Mary Taliaferro French. Attorney in Montgomery County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned seventeen enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1850. Attorney in Montgomery County in 1860. Presiding judge of the Montgomery County Court in Montgomery County in 1860. Owned three enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860. Household owned an additional nine enslaved persons in Montgomery County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1, p. 10B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, District 1, p. 36.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 201.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Montgomery County, p. 88B-89A.

Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Clark County Marriages, Film #001943687, p.170
